1 /*!
  2  * Hasher <http://github.com/millermedeiros/Hasher>
  3  * Includes: js-signals (::js-signals_version::), millermedeiros.queryUtils (0.8.2), millermedeiros.event-listenerFacade (0.3)
  4  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
  5  * @version 0.9.9 ::BUILD_DATE::
  6  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
  7  */
  8 (function(window, document){
  9 /*
 10  * Miller Medeiros JS Library
 11  * @author Miller Medeiros
 12  * @version 0.1.1 (2010/11/01)
 13  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
 14  */
 15  
 16 /**
 17  * @namespace Miller Medeiros Namespace
 18  * @name millermedeiros
 19  */
 20 var millermedeiros = window.millermedeiros = {};
 21 (function(window, millermedeiros){
 22 	
 23 	var location = window.location; //local storage for better minification
 24 
 25 	/**
 26 	 * @namespace Utilities for query string manipulation.
 27 	 * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
 28 	 * @version 0.8.3 (2010/11/01)
 29 	 * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
 30 	 */
 31 	millermedeiros.queryUtils = {
 32 		
 33 		/**
 34 		 * Gets full query as string with all special chars decoded.
 35 		 * @param {string} [url]	 URL to be parsed, defaults to `location.href`
 36 		 * @return {string}	Query string
 37 		 */
 38 		getQueryString : function(url){
 39 			url = url || location.href; //used location.href to avoid bug on IE6 and pseudo query string inside location.hash
 40 			url = url.replace(/#[\w\W]*/, ''); //removes hash (to avoid getting hash query)
 41 			var queryString = /\?[a-zA-Z0-9\=\&\%\$\-\_\.\+\!\*\'\(\)\,]+/.exec(url); //valid chars according to: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt
 42 			return (queryString)? decodeURIComponent(queryString[0]) : '';
 43 		},
 44 		
 45 		/**
 46 		 * Gets query as Object.
 47 		 * - Alias for `millermedeiros.queryUtils.toQueryObject( millermedeiros.queryUtils.getQueryString(url) )`
 48 		 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href.
 49 		 * @return {Object.<string, (string|number)>}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
 50 		 */
 51 		getQueryObject : function(url){
 52 			return this.toQueryObject(this.getQueryString(url));
 53 		},
 54 		
 55 		/**
 56 		 * Convert Query String into an Object
 57 		 * @param {string} queryString	 Query String to be parsed
 58 		 * @return {Object.<string, (string|number)>}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
 59 		 */
 60 		toQueryObject : function(queryString){
 61 			var queryArr = queryString.replace('?', '').split('&'), 
 62 				n = queryArr.length,
 63 				queryObj = {},
 64 				value;
 65 			while (n--) {
 66 				queryArr[n] = queryArr[n].split('=');
 67 				value = queryArr[n][1];
 68 				queryObj[queryArr[n][0]] = isNaN(value)? value : parseFloat(value);
 69 			}
 70 			return queryObj;
 71 		},
 72 		
 73 		/**
 74 		 * Get query parameter value.
 75 		 * @param {string} param	Parameter name.
 76 		 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
 77 		 * @return {(string|number)}	Parameter value.
 78 		 */
 79 		getParamValue : function(param, url){
 80 			url = url || location.href;
 81 			var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param + '=([^&]*)'), //matches `?param=value` or `¶m=value`, value = $2
 82 				result = regexp.exec(url),
 83 				value = (result && result[2])? result[2] : null;
 84 			return isNaN(value)? value : parseFloat(value);
 85 		},
 86 		
 87 		/**
 88 		 * Checks if query contains parameter.
 89 		 * @param {string} param	Parameter name.
 90 		 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
 91 		 * @return {boolean} If parameter exist.
 92 		 */
 93 		hasParam : function(param, url){
 94 			var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param +'=', 'g'); //matches `?param=` or `¶m=`
 95 			return regexp.test(this.getQueryString(url));
 96 		},
 97 		
 98 		/**
 99 		 * Converts object into query string.
100 		 * @param {Object} obj	Object with "params => values" pairs.
101 		 * @return {string}	Formated query string starting with '?'.
102 		 */
103 		toQueryString : function(obj){
104 			var query = [],
105 				param;
106 			for(param in obj){
107 				if(obj.hasOwnProperty(param)){ //avoid copying properties from the prototype
108 					query.push(param +'='+ obj[param]);
109 				}
110 			}
111 			return (query.length)? '?'+ query.join('&') : '';
112 		}
113 		
114 	};
115 
116 }(window, millermedeiros));
117 /*
118  * millermedeiros.event - DOM Event Listener Facade
119  * - Cross-browser DOM Event Listener attachment/detachment.
120  * - Based on Peter-Paul Koch addEventSimple <http://www.quirksmode.org/js/eventSimple.html>
121  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
122  * @version 0.3 (2010/06/23)
123  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
124  */
125 
126 /**
127  * @namespace Utilities for Browser Native Events
128  */
129 millermedeiros.event = millermedeiros.event || {};
130 
131 /**
132 * Adds DOM Event Listener
133 * @param {Element} elm Element.
134 * @param {string} eType Event type.
135 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
136 */
137 millermedeiros.event.addListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
138 	if(elm.addEventListener){
139 		elm.addEventListener(eType, fn, false);
140 	}else if(elm.attachEvent){
141 		elm.attachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
142 	}else{
143 		elm['on' + eType] = fn;
144 	}
145 };
146 
147 /**
148 * Removes DOM Event Listener
149 * @param {Element} elm Element.
150 * @param {string} eType Event type.
151 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
152 */
153 millermedeiros.event.removeListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
154 	if(elm.removeEventListener){
155 		elm.removeEventListener(eType, fn, false);
156 	}else if(elm.detachEvent){
157 		elm.detachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
158 	}else{
159 		elm['on' + eType] = null;
160 	}
161 };
162 }(window, window.document));
163 /*!!
164  * JS Signals <https://github.com/millermedeiros/js-signals>
165  * Released under the MIT license (http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php)
166  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://millermedeiros.com>
167  * @version 0.5
168  * @build 100 12/03/2010 05:27 PM
169  */
170 (function(){
171 	
172 	/**
173 	 * @namespace Signals Namespace - Custom event/messaging system based on AS3 Signals
174 	 * @name signals
175 	 */
176 	var signals = window.signals = {};
177 	
178 	/**
179 	 * Signals Version Number
180 	 * @type string
181 	 * @const
182 	 */
183 	signals.VERSION = '0.5';
184 	
185 	/**
186 	 * @param {*} param	Parameter to check.
187 	 * @return {boolean} `true` if parameter is different than `undefined`.
188 	 */
189 	signals.isDef = function(param){
190 		return typeof param !== 'undefined';
191 	};
192 
193 	/**
194 	 * Signal - custom event broadcaster
195 	 * <br />- inspired by Robert Penner's AS3 Signals.
196 	 * @author Miller Medeiros
197 	 * @constructor
198 	 */
199 	signals.Signal = function(){
200 		/**
201 		 * @type Array.<signals.SignalBinding>
202 		 * @private
203 		 */
204 		this._bindings = [];
205 	};
206 	
207 	
208 	signals.Signal.prototype = {
209 		
210 		/**
211 		 * @type boolean
212 		 * @private
213 		 */
214 		_shouldPropagate : true,
215 		
216 		/**
217 		 * @type boolean
218 		 * @private
219 		 */
220 		_isEnabled : true,
221 		
222 		/**
223 		 * @param {Function} listener
224 		 * @param {boolean} isOnce
225 		 * @param {Object} [scope]
226 		 * @return {signals.SignalBinding}
227 		 * @private
228 		 */
229 		_registerListener : function(listener, isOnce, scope){
230 			
231 			if(!signals.isDef(listener)) throw new Error('listener is a required param of add() and addOnce().');
232 			
233 			var prevIndex = this._indexOfListener(listener),
234 				binding;
235 			
236 			if(prevIndex !== -1){ //avoid creating a new Binding for same listener if already added to list
237 				binding = this._bindings[prevIndex];
238 				if(binding.isOnce() !== isOnce){
239 					throw new Error('You cannot add'+ (isOnce? '' : 'Once') +'() then add'+ (!isOnce? '' : 'Once') +'() the same listener without removing the relationship first.');
240 				}
241 			} else {
242 				binding = new signals.SignalBinding(listener, isOnce, scope, this);
243 				this._addBinding(binding);
244 			}
245 			
246 			return binding;
247 		},
248 		
249 		/**
250 		 * @param {signals.SignalBinding} binding
251 		 * @private
252 		 */
253 		_addBinding : function(binding){
254 			this._bindings.push(binding);
255 		},
256 		
257 		/**
258 		 * @param {Function} listener
259 		 * @return {int}
260 		 * @private
261 		 */
262 		_indexOfListener : function(listener){
263 			var n = this._bindings.length;
264 			while(n--){
265 				if(this._bindings[n]._listener === listener) return n;
266 			}
267 			return -1;
268 		},
269 		
270 		/**
271 		 * Add a listener to the signal.
272 		 * @param {Function} listener	Signal handler function.
273 		 * @param {Object} [scope]	Context on which listener will be executed (object that should represent the `this` variable inside listener function).
274 		 * @return {signals.SignalBinding} An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.
275 		 */
276 		add : function(listener, scope){
277 			return this._registerListener(listener, false, scope);
278 		},
279 		
280 		/**
281 		 * Add listener to the signal that should be removed after first execution (will be executed only once).
282 		 * @param {Function} listener	Signal handler function.
283 		 * @param {Object} [scope]	Context on which listener will be executed (object that should represent the `this` variable inside listener function).
284 		 * @return {signals.SignalBinding} An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.
285 		 */
286 		addOnce : function(listener, scope){
287 			return this._registerListener(listener, true, scope);
288 		},
289 		
290 		/**
291 		 * @private
292 		 */
293 		_removeByIndex : function(i){
294 			this._bindings[i]._destroy(); //no reason to a SignalBinding exist if it isn't attached to a signal
295 			this._bindings.splice(i, 1);
296 		},
297 		
298 		/**
299 		 * Remove a single listener from the dispatch queue.
300 		 * @param {Function} listener	Handler function that should be removed.
301 		 * @return {Function} Listener handler function.
302 		 */
303 		remove : function(listener){
304 			if(!signals.isDef(listener)) throw new Error('listener is a required param of remove().');
305 			
306 			var i = this._indexOfListener(listener);
307 			if(i !== -1) this._removeByIndex(i);
308 			return listener;
309 		},
310 		
311 		/**
312 		 * Remove all listeners from the Signal.
313 		 */
314 		removeAll : function(){
315 			var n = this._bindings.length;
316 			while(n--){
317 				this._removeByIndex(n);
318 			}
319 		},
320 		
321 		/**
322 		 * @return {uint} Number of listeners attached to the Signal.
323 		 */
324 		getNumListeners : function(){
325 			return this._bindings.length;
326 		},
327 		
328 		/**
329 		 * Disable Signal, will block dispatch to listeners until `enable()` is called.
330 		 * @see signals.Signal.prototype.enable
331 		 */
332 		disable : function(){
333 			this._isEnabled = false;
334 		},
335 		
336 		/**
337 		 * Enable broadcast to listeners.
338 		 * @see signals.Signal.prototype.disable
339 		 */
340 		enable : function(){
341 			this._isEnabled = true;
342 		}, 
343 		
344 		/**
345 		 * @return {boolean} If Signal is currently enabled and will broadcast message to listeners.
346 		 */
347 		isEnabled : function(){
348 			return this._isEnabled;
349 		},
350 		
351 		/**
352 		 * Stop propagation of the event, blocking the dispatch to next listeners on the queue.
353 		 * - should be called only during signal dispatch, calling it before/after dispatch won't affect signal broadcast. 
354 		 */
355 		halt : function(){
356 			this._shouldPropagate = false;
357 		},
358 		
359 		/**
360 		 * Dispatch/Broadcast Signal to all listeners added to the queue. 
361 		 * @param {...*} [params]	Parameters that should be passed to each handler.
362 		 */
363 		dispatch : function(params){
364 			if(! this._isEnabled) return;
365 			
366 			var paramsArr = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments),
367 				bindings = this._bindings.slice(), //clone array in case add/remove items during dispatch
368 				i = 0,
369 				cur;
370 			
371 			this._shouldPropagate = true; //in case `halt` was called before dispatch or during the previous dispatch.
372 						
373 			while(cur = bindings[i++]){
374 				if(cur.execute(paramsArr) === false || !this._shouldPropagate) break; //execute all callbacks until end of the list or until a callback returns `false` or stops propagation
375 			}
376 		},
377 		
378 		/**
379 		 * Remove binding from signal and destroy any reference to external Objects (destroy Signal object).
380 		 * <br /> - calling methods on the signal instance after calling dispose will throw errors.
381 		 */
382 		dispose : function(){
383 			this.removeAll();
384 			delete this._bindings;
385 		},
386 		
387 		/**
388 		 * @return {string} String representation of the object.
389 		 */
390 		toString : function(){
391 			return '[Signal isEnabled: '+ this._isEnabled +' numListeners: '+ this.getNumListeners() +']';
392 		}
393 		
394 	};
395 	
396 	/**
397 	 * Object that represents a binding between a Signal and a listener function.
398 	 * <br />- <strong>Constructor shouldn't be called by regular user, used internally.</strong>
399 	 * <br />- inspired by Joa Ebert AS3 SignalBinding and Robert Penner's Slot classes.
400 	 * @author Miller Medeiros
401 	 * @constructor
402 	 * @param {Function} listener	Handler function bound to the signal.
403 	 * @param {boolean} isOnce	If binding should be executed just once.
404 	 * @param {?Object} listenerContext	Context on which listener will be executed (object that should represent the `this` variable inside listener function).
405 	 * @param {signals.Signal} signal	Reference to Signal object that listener is currently bound to.
406 	 */
407 	signals.SignalBinding = function(listener, isOnce, listenerContext, signal){
408 		
409 		/**
410 		 * Handler function bound to the signal.
411 		 * @type Function
412 		 * @private
413 		 */
414 		this._listener = listener;
415 		
416 		/**
417 		 * If binding should be executed just once.
418 		 * @type boolean
419 		 * @private
420 		 */
421 		this._isOnce = isOnce;
422 		
423 		/**
424 		 * Context on which listener will be executed (object that should represent the `this` variable inside listener function).
425 		 * @type Object
426 		 */
427 		this.context = listenerContext;
428 		
429 		/**
430 		 * Reference to Signal object that listener is currently bound to.
431 		 * @type signals.Signal
432 		 * @private
433 		 */
434 		this._signal = signal;
435 	};
436 	
437 	
438 	signals.SignalBinding.prototype = {
439 		
440 		/**
441 		 * @type boolean
442 		 * @private
443 		 */
444 		_isEnabled : true,
445 		
446 		/**
447 		 * Call listener passing arbitrary parameters.
448 		 * <p>If binding was added using `Signal.addOnce()` it will be automatically removed from signal dispatch queue, this method is used internally for the signal dispatch.</p> 
449 		 * @param {Array} [paramsArr]	Array of parameters that should be passed to the listener
450 		 * @return {*} Value returned by the listener.
451 		 */
452 		execute : function(paramsArr){
453 			var r;
454 			if(this._isEnabled){
455 				r = this._listener.apply(this.context, paramsArr);
456 				if(this._isOnce) this.detach();
457 			}
458 			return r; //avoid warnings on some editors
459 		},
460 		
461 		/**
462 		 * Detach binding from signal.
463 		 * - alias to: mySignal.remove(myBinding.getListener());
464 		 * @return {Function} Handler function bound to the signal.
465 		 */
466 		detach : function(){
467 			return this._signal.remove(this._listener);
468 		},
469 		
470 		/**
471 		 * @return {Function} Handler function bound to the signal.
472 		 */
473 		getListener : function(){
474 			return this._listener;
475 		},
476 		
477 		/**
478 		 * Remove binding from signal and destroy any reference to external Objects (destroy SignalBinding object).
479 		 * <br /> - calling methods on the binding instance after calling dispose will throw errors.
480 		 */
481 		dispose : function(){
482 			this.detach();
483 			this._destroy();
484 		},
485 		
486 		/**
487 		 * Delete all instance properties
488 		 * @private
489 		 */
490 		_destroy : function(){
491 			delete this._signal;
492 			delete this._isOnce;
493 			delete this._listener;
494 			delete this.context;
495 		},
496 		
497 		/**
498 		 * Disable SignalBinding, block listener execution. Listener will only be executed after calling `enable()`.  
499 		 * @see signals.SignalBinding.enable()
500 		 */
501 		disable : function(){
502 			this._isEnabled = false;
503 		},
504 		
505 		/**
506 		 * Enable SignalBinding. Enable listener execution.
507 		 * @see signals.SignalBinding.disable()
508 		 */
509 		enable : function(){
510 			this._isEnabled = true;
511 		},
512 		
513 		/**
514 		 * @return {boolean} If SignalBinding is currently paused and won't execute listener during dispatch.
515 		 */
516 		isEnabled : function(){
517 			return this._isEnabled;
518 		},
519 		
520 		/**
521 		 * @return {boolean} If SignalBinding will only be executed once.
522 		 */
523 		isOnce : function(){
524 			return this._isOnce;
525 		},
526 		
527 		/**
528 		 * @return {string} String representation of the object.
529 		 */
530 		toString : function(){
531 			return '[SignalBinding isOnce: '+ this._isOnce +', isEnabled: '+ this._isEnabled +']';
532 		}
533 		
534 	};
535 }());
536 /*
537  * Hasher
538  * - History Manager for rich-media applications.
539  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
540  * @version 0.9.9
541  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
542  */
543 (function(window, document){
544 	
545 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
546 	// Private Vars
547 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
548 	
549 	var 
550 		
551 		//--- local storage for brevity, performance improvement and better compression ---//
552 		
553 		/** @private {Location} */
554 		location = window.location,
555 		
556 		/** @private {History} */
557 		history = window.history,
558 		
559 		/** @private {HasherEvent} */
560 		HasherEvent = window.HasherEvent,
561 		
562 		/** @private {millermedeiros} */
563 		millermedeiros = window.millermedeiros,
564 		
565 		/** @private */
566 		Hasher = {},
567 		
568 		/** @private {millermedeiros.queryUtils} Utilities for query string manipulation */
569 		_queryUtils = millermedeiros.queryUtils,
570 		
571 		/** @private {millermedeiros.event} Browser native events facade */
572 		_eventFacade = millermedeiros.event,
573 		
574 		/** @private {signals.Signal} */
575 		Signal = signals.Signal,
576 		
577 		//--- local vars ---//
578 		
579 		/** @private {string} previous/current hash value */
580 		_hash, 
581 		
582 		/** @private {number} stores setInterval reference (used to check if hash changed on non-standard browsers) */
583 		_checkInterval,
584 		
585 		/** @private {boolean} If Hasher is active and should listen to changes on the window location hash */
586 		_isActive,
587 		
588 		/** @private {Element} iframe used for IE <= 7 */
589 		_frame,
590 		
591 		
592 		//--- sniffing/feature detection ---//
593 		
594 		/** @private {string} User Agent */
595 		_UA = navigator.userAgent,
596 		
597 		/** @private {boolean} if is IE */
598 		_isIE = /MSIE/.test(_UA) && (!window.opera),
599 		
600 		/** @private {boolean} If browser supports the `hashchange` event - FF3.6+, IE8+, Chrome 5+, Safari 5+ */
601 		_isHashChangeSupported = ('onhashchange' in window),
602 		
603 		/** @private {boolean} if is IE <= 7 */
604 		_isLegacyIE = _isIE && !_isHashChangeSupported, //check if is IE6-7 since hash change is only supported on IE8+ and changing hash value on IE6-7 doesn't generate history record.
605 		
606 		/** @private {boolean} If it is a local file */
607 		_isLocal = (location.protocol === 'file:');
608 	
609 	
610 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
611 	// Private Methods
612 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
613 	
614 	/**
615 	 * Remove `Hasher.prependHash` and `Hasher.appendHash` from hashValue
616 	 * @param {string} [hash]	Hash value
617 	 * @return {string}
618 	 * @private
619 	 */
620 	function _trimHash(hash){
621 		hash = hash || '';
622 		var regexp = new RegExp('^\\'+ Hasher.prependHash +'|\\'+ Hasher.appendHash +'$', 'g'); //match appendHash and prependHash
623 		return hash.replace(regexp, '');
624 	}
625 	
626 	/**
627 	 * Get hash value stored inside iframe
628 	 * - used for IE <= 7. [HACK] 
629 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
630 	 * @private
631 	 */
632 	function _getFrameHash(){
633 		return (_frame)? _frame.contentWindow.frameHash : null;
634 	}
635 	
636 	/**
637 	 * Update iframe content, generating a history record and saving current hash/title on IE <= 7. [HACK]
638 	 * - based on Really Simple History, SWFAddress and YUI.history solutions.
639 	 * @param {(string|null)} hashValue	Hash value without '#'.
640 	 * @private
641 	 */
642 	function _updateFrame(hashValue){
643 		if(_frame && hashValue != _getFrameHash()){
644 			var frameDoc = _frame.contentWindow.document;
645 			frameDoc.open();
646 			frameDoc.write('<html><head><title>' + Hasher.getTitle() + '</title><script type="text/javascript">var frameHash="' + hashValue + '";</script></head><body> </body></html>'); //stores current hash inside iframe.
647 			frameDoc.close();
648 		}
649 	}
650 	
651 	/**
652 	 * Stores new hash value and dispatch change event if Hasher is "active".
653 	 * @param {string} newHash	New Hash Value.
654 	 * @private
655 	 */
656 	function _registerChange(newHash){
657 		newHash = decodeURIComponent(newHash); //fix IE8 while offline
658 		if(_hash != newHash){
659 			var oldHash = _hash;
660 			_hash = newHash; //should come before event dispatch to make sure user can get proper value inside event handler
661 			if(_isLegacyIE){
662 				_updateFrame(newHash);
663 			}
664 			Hasher.changed.dispatch(_trimHash(newHash), _trimHash(oldHash));
665 		}
666 	}
667 	
668 	/**
669 	 * Creates iframe used to record history state on IE <= 7. [HACK]
670 	 * @private
671 	 */
672 	function _createFrame(){
673 		_frame = document.createElement('iframe');
674 		_frame.src = 'about:blank';
675 		_frame.style.display = 'none';
676 		document.body.appendChild(_frame);
677 	}
678 	
679 	/**
680 	 * Get hash value from current URL
681 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
682 	 * @private
683 	 */
684 	function _getWindowHash(){
685 		//parsed full URL instead of getting location.hash because Firefox decode hash value (and all the other browsers don't)
686 		//also because of IE8 bug with hash query in local file [issue #6]
687 		var result = /#(.*)$/.exec( Hasher.getURL() );
688 		return (result && result[1])? decodeURIComponent(result[1]) : '';
689 	}
690 	
691 	/**
692 	 * Checks if hash/history state has changed
693 	 * @private
694 	 */
695 	function _checkHistory(){
696 		var curHash = _getWindowHash();
697 		if(curHash != _hash){
698 			_registerChange(curHash);
699 		}
700 	}
701 	
702 	/**
703 	 * Check if browser history state has changed on IE <= 7. [HACK]
704 	 * - used since IE 6,7 doesn't generates new history record on hashchange.
705 	 * @private
706 	 */
707 	function _checkHistoryLegacyIE(){
708 		var windowHash = _getWindowHash(),
709 			frameHash = _trimHash(_getFrameHash());
710 		if(frameHash != _hash && frameHash != windowHash){ //detect changes made pressing browser history buttons. Workaround since history.back() and history.forward() doesn't update hash value on IE6/7 but updates content of the iframe.
711 			Hasher.setHash(frameHash);
712 		}else if(windowHash != _hash){ //detect if hash changed (manually or using setHash)
713 			_registerChange(windowHash);
714 		}
715 	}
716 	
717 	
718 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
719 	// Public (API)
720 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
721 	
722 	/**
723 	 * Hasher
724 	 * @namespace History Manager for rich-media applications.
725 	 * @name Hasher
726 	 */
727 	window.Hasher = Hasher; //register Hasher to the global scope
728 	
729 	/**
730 	 * Hasher Version Number
731 	 * @type string
732 	 * @constant
733 	 */
734 	Hasher.VERSION = '0.9.9';
735 	
736 	/**
737 	 * String that should always be added to the end of Hash value.
738 	 * <ul>
739 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
740 	 * <li>will be automatically removed from `Hasher.getHash()`</li>
741 	 * <li>avoid conflicts with elements that contain ID equal to hash value;</li>
742 	 * </ul>
743 	 * @type string
744 	 */
745 	Hasher.appendHash = '/';
746 	
747 	/**
748 	 * String that should always be added to the beginning of Hash value.
749 	 * <ul>
750 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
751 	 * <li>will be automatically removed from `Hasher.getHash()`</li>
752 	 * <li>avoid conflicts with elements that contain ID equal to hash value;</li>
753 	 * </ul>
754 	 * @type string
755 	 */
756 	Hasher.prependHash = '/';
757 	
758 	/**
759 	 * String used to split hash paths; used by `Hasher.getHashAsArray()` to split paths.
760 	 * <ul>
761 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
762 	 * </ul>
763 	 * @type string
764 	 */
765 	Hasher.separator = '/';
766 	
767 	/**
768 	 * Signal dispatched when hash value changes
769 	 * @type signals.Signal
770 	 */
771 	Hasher.changed = new Signal();
772 	
773 	/**
774    * Signal dispatched when hasher is stopped
775    * @type signals.Signal
776    */
777   Hasher.stopped = new Signal();
778   
779 	/**
780    * Signal dispatched when hasher is initialized
781    * @type signals.Signal
782    */
783   Hasher.initialized = new Signal();
784 
785 	/**
786 	 * Start listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
787 	 * - Hasher won't dispatch CHANGE events by manually typing a new value or pressing the back/forward buttons before calling this method.
788 	 */
789 	Hasher.init = function(){
790 		if(_isActive){
791 			return;
792 		}
793 		
794 		var oldHash = _hash;
795 		_hash = _getWindowHash();
796 		
797 		//thought about branching/overloading Hasher.init() to avoid checking multiple times but don't think worth doing it since it probably won't be called multiple times. [?] 
798 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
799 			_eventFacade.addListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
800 		}else { 
801 			if(_isLegacyIE){
802 				if(!_frame){
803 					_createFrame();
804 					_updateFrame(_hash);
805 				}
806 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistoryLegacyIE, 25);
807 			}else{
808 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistory, 25);
809 			}
810 		}
811 		
812 		_isActive = true;
813 		this.initialized.dispatch(_trimHash(_hash), _trimHash(oldHash));
814 	};
815 	
816 	/**
817 	 * Stop listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
818 	 * - Hasher won't dispatch CHANGE events by manually typing a new value or pressing the back/forward buttons after calling this method, unless you call Hasher.init() again.
819 	 * - Hasher will still dispatch changes made programatically by calling Hasher.setHash();
820 	 */
821 	Hasher.stop = function(){
822 		if(!_isActive){
823 			return;
824 		}
825 		
826 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
827 			_eventFacade.removeListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
828 		}else{
829 			clearInterval(_checkInterval);
830 			_checkInterval = null;
831 		}
832 		
833 		_isActive = false;
834 		this.stopped.dispatch(_trimHash(_hash), _trimHash(_hash)); //since it didn't changed oldHash and newHash should be the same. [?]
835 	};
836 	
837 	/**
838 	 * Retrieve if Hasher is listening to changes on the browser history and/or hash value.
839 	 * @return {boolean}	If Hasher is listening to changes on the browser history and/or hash value.
840 	 */
841 	Hasher.isActive = function(){
842 		return _isActive;
843 	};
844 	
845 	/**
846 	 * Retrieve full URL.
847 	 * @return {string}	Full URL.
848 	 */
849 	Hasher.getURL = function(){
850 		return location.href;
851 	};
852 	
853 	/**
854 	 * Retrieve URL without query string and hash.
855 	 * @return {string}	Base URL.
856 	 */
857 	Hasher.getBaseURL = function(){
858 		return this.getURL().replace(/(\?.*)|(\#.*)/, ''); //removes everything after '?' and/or '#'
859 	};
860 	
861 	/**
862 	 * Set Hash value.
863 	 * @param {string} value	Hash value without '#'.
864 	 */
865 	Hasher.setHash = function(value){
866 		value = (value)? this.prependHash + value.replace(/^\#/, '') + this.appendHash : value; //removes '#' from the beginning of string and append/prepend default values.
867 		if(value != _hash){
868 			_registerChange(value); //avoid breaking the application if for some reason `location.hash` don't change
869 			if(_isIE && _isLocal){
870 				value = value.replace(/\?/, '%3F'); //fix IE8 local file bug [issue #6]
871 			}
872 			location.hash = '#'+ encodeURI(value); //used encodeURI instead of encodeURIComponent to preserve '?', '/', '#'. Fixes Safari bug [issue #8]
873 		}
874 	};
875 	
876 	/**
877 	 * Return hash value as String.
878 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
879 	 */
880 	Hasher.getHash = function(){
881 		//didn't used actual value of the `location.hash` to avoid breaking the application in case `location.hash` isn't available and also because value should always be synched.
882 		return _trimHash(_hash);
883 	};
884 	
885 	/**
886 	 * Return hash value as Array.	
887 	 * @return {Array.<string>}	Hash splitted into an Array.  
888 	 */
889 	Hasher.getHashAsArray = function(){
890 		return this.getHash().split(this.separator);
891 	};
892 	
893 	/**
894 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as a String
895 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.getQueryString( Hasher.getHash() ).substr(1);`
896 	 * @return {string}	Hash Query without '?'
897 	 */
898 	Hasher.getHashQuery = function(){
899 		return _queryUtils.getQueryString( this.getHash() ).substr(1);
900 	};
901 	
902 	/**
903 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as an Object
904 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.toQueryObject( Hasher.getHashQueryString() );`
905 	 * @return {Object} Hash Query
906 	 */
907 	Hasher.getHashQueryAsObject = function(){
908 		return _queryUtils.toQueryObject( this.getHashQuery() );
909 	};
910 	
911 	/**
912 	 * Get parameter value from the query portion of the Hash
913 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, Hasher.getHash() );`
914 	 * @param {string} paramName	Parameter Name.
915 	 * @return {string}	Parameter value.
916 	 */
917 	Hasher.getHashQueryParam = function(paramName){
918 		return _queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, this.getHash() );
919 	};
920 	
921 	/**
922 	 * Set page title
923 	 * @param {string} value	Page Title
924 	 */
925 	Hasher.setTitle = function(value){
926 		document.title = value;
927 	};
928 	
929 	/**
930 	 * Get page title
931 	 * @return {string} Page Title
932 	 */
933 	Hasher.getTitle = function(){
934 		return document.title;
935 	};
936 	
937 	/**
938 	 * Navigate to previous page in history
939 	 */
940 	Hasher.back = function(){
941 		history.back();
942 	};
943 	
944 	/**
945 	 * Navigate to next page in history
946 	 */
947 	Hasher.forward = function(){
948 		history.forward();
949 	};
950 	
951 	/**
952 	 * Loads a page from the session history, identified by its relative location to the current page.
953 	 * - for example `-1` loads previous page, `1` loads next page.
954 	 * @param {int} delta	Relative location to the current page.
955 	 */
956 	Hasher.go = function(delta){
957 		history.go(delta);
958 	};
959 	
960 	/**
961 	 * Replaces spaces with hyphens, split camel case text, remove non-word chars and remove accents.
962 	 * - based on Miller Medeiros JS Library -> millermedeiros.stringUtils.hyphenate
963 	 * @example Hasher.hyphenate('Lorem Ipsum  ?#$%^&*  splChrs') -> 'Lorem-Ipsum-special-chars'
964 	 * @param {string} str	String to be formated.
965 	 * @return {string}	Formated String
966 	 */
967 	Hasher.hyphenate = function(str){
968 		str = str || '';
969 		str = str
970 				.replace(/[^0-9a-zA-Z\xC0-\xFF \-]/g, '') //remove non-word chars
971 				.replace(/([a-z\xE0-\xFF])([A-Z\xC0\xDF])/g, '$1 $2') //add space between camelCase text
972 				.replace(/ +/g, '-'); //replace spaces with hyphen
973 		return this.removeAccents(str);
974 	};
975 	
976 	/**
977 	 * Replaces all accented chars with regular ones
978 	 * - copied from Miller Medeiros JS Library -> millermedeiros.stringUtils.replaceAccents
979 	 * @example Hasher.removeAccents('Lorem Ipsum  ?#$%^&*  splChrs') -> 'Lorem Ipsum  ?#$%^&*  specialChars'
980 	 * @param {string} str	String to be formated.
981 	 * @return {string}	Formated String
982 	 */
983 	Hasher.removeAccents = function(str){
984 		str = str || '';
985 		// verifies if the String has accents and replace accents
986 		if(str.search(/[\xC0-\xFF]/g) > -1){
987 			str = str
988 					.replace(/[\xC0-\xC5]/g, "A")
989 					.replace(/[\xC6]/g, "AE")
990 					.replace(/[\xC7]/g, "C")
991 					.replace(/[\xC8-\xCB]/g, "E")
992 					.replace(/[\xCC-\xCF]/g, "I")
993 					.replace(/[\xD0]/g, "D")
994 					.replace(/[\xD1]/g, "N")
995 					.replace(/[\xD2-\xD6\xD8]/g, "O")
996 					.replace(/[\xD9-\xDC]/g, "U")
997 					.replace(/[\xDD]/g, "Y")
998 					.replace(/[\xDE]/g, "P")
999 					.replace(/[\xDF]/g, "B")
1000 					.replace(/[\xE0-\xE5]/g, "a")
1001 					.replace(/[\xE6]/g, "ae")
1002 					.replace(/[\xE7]/g, "c")
1003 					.replace(/[\xE8-\xEB]/g, "e")
1004 					.replace(/[\xEC-\xEF]/g, "i")
1005 					.replace(/[\xF0]/g, "D")
1006 					.replace(/[\xF1]/g, "n")
1007 					.replace(/[\xF2-\xF6\xF8]/g, "o")
1008 					.replace(/[\xF9-\xFC]/g, "u")
1009 					.replace(/[\xFE]/g, "p")
1010 					.replace(/[\xFD\xFF]/g, "y");
1011 		}
1012 		return str;
1013 	};
1014 	
1015 	/**
1016 	 * Removes all event listeners, stops Hasher and destroy Hasher object.
1017 	 * - IMPORTANT: Hasher won't work after calling this method, Hasher Object will be deleted.
1018 	 */
1019 	Hasher.dispose = function(){
1020 		Hasher.initialized.removeAll();
1021 		Hasher.stopped.removeAll();
1022 		Hasher.changed.removeAll();
1023 		Hasher.stop();
1024 		_hash = _checkInterval = _isActive = _frame = _UA  = _isIE = _isLegacyIE = _isHashChangeSupported = _isLocal = _queryUtils = _eventFacade = Hasher = window.Hasher = null;
1025 		//can't use `delete window.hasher;` because on IE it throws errors, `window` isn't actually an object, delete can only be used on Object properties.
1026 	};
1027 	
1028 	/**
1029 	 * Returns string representation of the Hasher object.
1030 	 * @return {string} A string representation of the object.
1031 	 */
1032 	Hasher.toString = function(){
1033 		return '[Hasher version="'+ this.VERSION +'" hash="'+ this.getHash() +'"]';
1034 	};
1035 	
1036 }(window, window.document));
1037
